numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graphs show total energy generation by country.
2. The text says that the graphs exclude imports and exports.
3. Therefore the graphs probably do not represent energy usage by that country.
4. Some countries are net importers of energy.
5. If a country is a net importer of energy then the total energy consumption of the country is higher than the total energy generation of the country.
6. Some countries are net exporters of energy.
7. If a country is a net exporter of energy then the total energy consumption of the country is lower than the total energy generation of the country.
8. The graphs show trends in energy production.
9. Overall energy production has nearly doubled in 22 years.
10. Coal and gas make up the largest part of the market.
11. Wind production is increasing at the fastest rate.
12. Solar production is increasing at the fastest rate.
13. Nuclear production has slightly reduced.
14. Other energy production has slightly reduced.
15. Hydro production has slightly increased.
16. There is a dip in energy production around 2008.
17. There is a dip in energy production around 2019.
18. The dip around 2008 is less pronounced in coal production.
19. The dip around 2019 is less pronounced in coal production.
20. I do not know what caused these dips.
21. The Global Financial Crisis happened around 2008.
22. COVID-19 happened around 2019.
23. These events may have caused the dips.
24. China produces the most coal.
25. Coal production in China has increased around 4 times since 2000.
26. China looks to be the biggest coal producer in the world.
27. The United States is a country.
28. Coal production in the United States has decreased by more than half since 2000.
29. Oil production in the United States has increased since 2000.
30. Oil production and gas production in the United States have stayed fairly steady in total.
31. Oil production and gas production in the United States make up more than half of overall energy production in the United States.
32. Overall energy production in the United States has stayed fairly steady over 22 years.
33. India produces much less energy than the other countries.
34. Energy production in India is mostly coal production.
